TopicTitle: Changing upper (pod) section of built vessel?

Articles.Content:
I have a Duna orbiter I built and used for my first trip to Duna. Now I would like to keep all the lower stages intact but change the upper to a Lander. I don't seem to know how to do that...whenever I remove the installed pod at the top, the rest of the ship gets "greyed out" and I cannot replace the upper section with a new lander can.

What am I missing here?

Thanks
you will need to reroot the ship to the top of the launcher, usually the decoupler, or the docking port depending on your design.

Just to expand on steuben's comment:  The very first piece that you placed when you built the ship becomes the "root".  For a lot of folks (certainly for me), that's usually the pod, which is what you're running into.

So, as steuben suggests, you need to "re-root" the ship (i.e. make another piece be the root).  There's a tool for that-- one of the buttons at top left, next to the "move" and "rotate" buttons, or you can hit the 4 key.

Once you've changed the ship root to something other than the pod, you can then delete the pod and replace it with whatever you like.
you could also save your lower part as a sub assembly, so when you build a lander you can just pop it in the bottom

I usually just detach the lower part of the rocket, ditch the old root part and select a new command pod/probe core. Move that new part up and you can then stick the old rocket on as a complete assembly.
